text.0: A 50-year-old man with history of large-cell neuroendocrince lung carcinoma presented with a 5-day history of shortness of breath, chest pain, and cough. Examination noted diminished breath sounds in the right lower lobe and cough after fluid intake. What is the diagnosis?
text.1:
Covid-19 Rx: Your task is to gather data, develop a differential diagnosis, order additional diagnostic tests, and treat the patient. (Optimized for desktop PCs and most tablets.) 
@NEJMGroup #COVID19
text.2: A 46-year-old man presented with diarrhea, weight loss, and abdominal pain and was found to have acute kidney injury. A renal biopsy was performed, and a diagnosis of renal cryptococcosis was made.
text.3: In a trial of the BNT162b2 vaccine, subjects received two doses of vaccine or placebo 21 days apart. In 36,523 subjects with no evidence of prior #SARSCoV2 infection, there were 8 cases of #COVID19 in vaccine recipients and 162 cases with placebo, for a vaccine efficacy of 95%.
